pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:0.4.eng: The training rule on above the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.0.2.eng: Homage to the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.1.comm: The numbering begins with five because the first four rules have been omitted. This is because these rules are almost identical to the rules entailing expulsion for the monks, the only difference being the first rule, which is worded slightly differently.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāḷho migāranattā bhikkhunisaṅghassa vihāraṃ kattukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.2.eng: Migāra’s grandson Sāḷha wanted to build a dwelling for the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.3.pli: Atha kho sāḷho migāranattā bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.3.eng: He went to the nuns and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.4.eng: “Venerables, I wish to build a dwelling for the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.5.eng: Please get me the nun in charge of building work.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena catasso bhaginiyo bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā honti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.6.eng: At that time four sisters had gone forth as nuns:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.8.pli: Tāsu sundarīnandā bhikkhunī taruṇapabbajitā abhirūpā hoti dassanīyā pāsādikā paṇḍitā byattā medhāvinī dakkhā analasā, tatrupāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgatā, alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.8.eng: Of these, the nun Sundarīnandā had gone forth when she was young, and she was beautiful, intelligent, skilled, and diligent, and she possessed good judgment in regard to doing and arranging things well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.9.pli: Atha kho bhikkhunisaṅgho sundarīnandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammannitvā sāḷhassa migāranattuno navakammikaṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.9.eng: After appointing Sundarīnandā to be in charge of building work, the Sangha made her work with Sāḷha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.10.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sundarīnandā bhikkhunī sāḷhassa migāranattuno nivesanaṃ abhikkhaṇaṃ gacchati—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.10.eng: As a consequence of this, Sundarīnandā would often go to Sāḷha’s house to ask for tools,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.11.pli: “vāsiṃ detha, parasuṃ detha, kuṭhāriṃ detha, kudālaṃ detha, nikhādanaṃ dethā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.11.eng: whether an adz, a hatchet, an ax, a spade, or a chisel.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.12.pli: Sāḷhopi migāranattā bhikkhunupassayaṃ abhikkhaṇaṃ gacchati katākataṃ jānituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.12.eng: And Sāḷha would often go to the nuns’ dwelling place to find out about the progress of the building work.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.12.comm: “Nunnery” renders upassaya. According to the word definition at Bu Pc 23, this includes any place where a nun stays. In other words, it spans anything from a single hut, see Bi Pc 35, to a monastery. The Jain text The Ācārāṅga-sūtra, contains a passage that describes an upassaya as including a grassy area, that is, it must have been a compound of buildings or a monastery: “A layman might, for the sake of a mendicant ... cutting and clipping the grass outside or within the upāśraya (= upassaya).” See Jacobi, Hermann, trans. “Jaina Sutras Part I”. Motilal Babarsidass, 1964, p. 94.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.13.eng: And because they saw each other frequently, they fell in love.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.14.pli: Atha kho sāḷho migāranattā sundarīnandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dūsetuṃ okāsaṃ alabhamāno etadevaatthāya bhikkhunisaṅghassa bhattaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.14.eng: But because Sāḷha could not find any opportunity to be intimate with Sundarīnandā, he invited the Sangha of nuns for a meal.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.15.pli: Atha kho sāḷho migāranattā bhattagge āsanaṃ paññapento “ettakā bhikkhuniyo ayyāya sundarīnandāya vuḍḍhatarā”ti—ekamantaṃ āsanaṃ paññapesi “ettakā navakatarā”ti—ekamantaṃ āsanaṃ paññapesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.15.eng: When preparing the seats in the dining hall, he counted the number of nuns senior to Venerable Sundarīnandā and placed their seats to one side, and he counted the number of nuns junior to her and placed their seats on the other side.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.16.pli: Paṭicchanne okāse nikūṭe sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā āsanaṃ paññapesi, yathā therā bhikkhuniyo jāneyyuṃ—“navakānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ santike nisinnā”ti; navakāpi bhikkhuniyo jāneyyuṃ—“therānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ santike nisinnā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.16.eng: He then placed Sundarīnandā’s seat in a concealed spot in a corner. In this way the senior nuns would think she was seated close to the junior ones and the junior nuns would think she was seated close to the senior ones.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.17.pli: Atha kho sāḷho migāranattā bhikkhunisaṅghassa kālaṃ ārocāpesi—“kālo, ayye, niṭṭhitaṃ bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.17.eng: Soon afterwards he informed the Sangha that the meal was ready.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.18.pli: Sundarīnandā bhikkhunī sallakkhetvā—“na bahukato sāḷho migāranattā bhikkhunisaṅghassa bhattaṃ akāsi; maṃ so dūsetukāmo.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.18.eng: Sundarīnandā thought, “Sāḷha hasn’t prepared a meal for the Sangha as a service, but because he wants to be intimate with me.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.19.pli: Sacāhaṃ gamissāmi vissaro me bhavissatī”ti, antevāsiniṃ bhikkhuniṃ āṇāpesi—“gaccha me piṇḍapātaṃ nīhara.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.19.eng: If I go, I will get into trouble.” She then told a nun who was her pupil, “Go and bring back almsfood for me.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.20.eng: If anyone asks about me, tell them I’m sick.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.21.pli: “Evaṃ, ayye”ti kho sā bhikkhunī sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā paccassosi.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.22.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāḷho migāranattā bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhito hoti sundarīnandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ paṭipucchanto—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.22.eng: Soon afterwards Sāḷha was standing outside his gatehouse repeatedly inquiring after Sundarīnandā:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.22.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “gatehouse” for koṭṭhaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.23.pli: “kahaṃ, ayye, ayyā sundarīnandā? Kahaṃ, ayye, ayyā sundarīnandā”ti?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.24.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā antevāsinī bhikkhunī sāḷhaṃ migāranattāraṃ etadavoca—“gilānāvuso; piṇḍapātaṃ nīharissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.24.eng: The nun who was Sundarīnandā’s pupil told him: “She’s sick. I’m bringing her almsfood.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.25.pli: Atha kho sāḷho migāranattā—“yampāhaṃ atthāya bhikkhunisaṅghassa bhattaṃ akāsiṃ ayyāya sundarīnandāya kāraṇā”ti manusse āṇāpetvā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.25.eng: Sāḷha thought, “I invited the Sangha of nuns because of Sundarīnandā,”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.26.pli: “bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ bhattena parivisathā”ti vatvā yena bhikkhunupassayo tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.26.eng: and after telling the people there to serve the meal to the Sangha of nuns, he left for the nuns’ dwelling place.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.27.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sundarīnandā bhikkhunī bahārāmakoṭṭhake ṭhitā hoti sāḷhaṃ migāranattāraṃ patimānentī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.27.eng: Just then Sundarīnandā was standing outside the monastery gatehouse longing for Sāḷha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.28.pli: Addasā kho sundarīnandā bhikkhunī sāḷhaṃ migāranattāraṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ. Disvāna upassayaṃ pavisitvā sasīsaṃ pārupitvā mañcake nipajji.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.28.eng: When she saw him coming, she entered the dwelling, put on her upper robe so that it covered her head, and lay down on her bed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.29.pli: Atha kho sāḷho migāranattā yena sundarīnandā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā sundarīnandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—“kiṃ te, ayye, aphāsu, kissa nipannāsī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.29.eng: Sāḷha approached her and said, “Venerable, what’s wrong with you? Why are you lying down?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.30.eng: “That’s what happens when you desire someone who doesn’t desire you in return.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.31.eng: “What do you mean I don’t desire you?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.32.pli: Api cāhaṃ okāsaṃ na labhāmi taṃ dūsetun”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.32.eng: I just couldn’t find an opportunity to be intimate with you.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.32.comm: “Intimate with” renders dūsetuṁ. For a discussion of the meaning of dūseti, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.33.pli: Avassuto avassutāya sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajji.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.33.eng: And both having lust, he made physical contact with Sundarīnandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.34.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī jarādubbalā caraṇagilānā sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā avidūre nipannā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.34.eng: Just then a nun who was weak from old age and had problems with her feet was lying down not far from Sundarīnandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.35.pli: Addasā kho sā bhikkhunī sāḷhaṃ migāranattāraṃ avassutaṃ avassutāya sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjantaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.35.eng: She saw how Sāḷha made physical contact with Sundarīnandā while both of them had lust.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.36.pli: Disvāna ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—“kathañhi nāma ayyā sundarīnandā avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.36.eng: She complained and criticized her, “How could Venerable Sundarīnandā consent to a man making physical contact with her, when they both had lust?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.37.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.37.eng: That nun then told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.38.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā santuṭṭhā lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.38.eng: The nuns of few desires, who had a sense of conscience, and who were contented, afraid of wrongdoing, and fond of the training, complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.39.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā sundarīnandā avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.39.eng: “How could Venerable Sundarīnandā consent to a man making physical contact with her, when they both had lust?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.40.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ. Ye te bhikkhū appicchā santuṭṭhā lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—“kathañhi nāma sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.40.eng: Those nuns then told the monks. And the monks of few desires, who had a sense of conscience, and who were contented, afraid of wrongdoing, and fond of the training, criticized her in the same way.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.41.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū sundarīnandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.41.eng: After rebuking the nun Sundarīnandā in many ways, they told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.42.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.42.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.43.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.43.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Sundarīnandā acted like this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.46.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.46.eng: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for the nun Sundarīnandā, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.47.pli: Kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.47.eng: How could Sundarīnandā consent to a man making physical contact with her, when they both had lust?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.48.pli: Netaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.49.pli: Atha khvetaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānañceva appasādāya pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.49.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.50.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sundarīnandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya dupposatāya mahicchatāya asantuṭṭhitāya saṅgaṇikāya kosajjassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā, anekapariyāyena subharatāya suposatāya appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā, bhikkhūnaṃ tadanucchavikaṃ tadanulomikaṃ dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.50.eng: And the Buddha spoke in many ways in dispraise of being difficult to support and maintain, in dispraise of great desires, discontent, socializing, and laziness; but he spoke in many ways in praise of being easy to support and maintain, of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, ascetic practices, serenity, reduction in things, and being energetic. After giving a teaching on what is right and proper, he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.51.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.51.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.52.pli: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya, dummaṅkūnaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ phāsuvihārāya, diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya, appasannānaṃ pasādāya, pasannānaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā vinayānuggahāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.52.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad nuns, for the ease of good nuns, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.52.comm: “Training” renders vinaya. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.53.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.53.eng: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.54.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ āmasanaṃ vā parāmasanaṃ vā gahaṇaṃ vā chupanaṃ vā paṭipīḷanaṃ vā sādiyeyya, ayampi pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalikā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.54.1.eng: ‘If a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, to touching her, to taking hold of her, to contacting her, or to squeezing her, anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on above the knees.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.54.1.comm: For a detailed discussion of this rule, see Appendix on Individual Bhikkhunī Rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.2.pli: yā yādisā yathāyuttā yathājaccā yathānāmā yathāgottā yathāsīlā yathāvihārinī yathāgocarā therā vā navā vā majjhimā vā, esā vuccati yā panāti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.2.eng: whoever, of such a kind, of such activity, of such caste, of such name, of such family, of such conduct, of such behavior, of such association, who is senior, who is junior, or who is of middle standing—this is called “a”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.4.eng: she is a nun because she lives on alms;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.5.eng: a nun because she has gone over to living on alms;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.6.eng: a nun because she wears a patchwork cloth;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.8.eng: a nun on account of her claim;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.10.eng: a nun given the full ordination by taking the three refuges;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.15.pli: samaggena ubhatosaṅghena ñatticatutthena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena upasampannāti bhikkhunī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.15.eng: a nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.16.pli: Tatra yāyaṃ bhikkhunī samaggena ubhatosaṅghena ñatticatutthena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena upasampannā, ayaṃ imasmiṃ atthe adhippetā bhikkhunīti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.16.eng: The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.18.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.20.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.22.pli: manussapuriso na yakkho na peto na tiracchānagato viññū paṭibalo kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.22.eng: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of making physical contact.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.36.eng: consents to the taking hold of a bodily part and then pressing.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.38.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.40.pli: seyyathāpi nāma puriso sīsacchinno abhabbo tena sarīrabandhanena jīvituṃ; evameva bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ āmasanaṃ vā parāmasanaṃ vā gahaṇaṃ vā chupanaṃ vā paṭipīḷanaṃ vā sādiyantī assamaṇī hoti asakyadhītā. Tena vuccati pārājikā hotīti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.40.eng: just as a man with his head cut off is unable to continue living by reconnecting it to the body, so is a lustful nun who consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, to touching her, to taking hold of her, to contacting her, or to squeezing her, anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, not a monastic, not a daughter of the Sakyan. Therefore it is said “she is expelled.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.42.pli: saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ekuddeso samasikkhatā— eso saṃvāso nāma.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.42.eng: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.43.pli: So tāya saddhiṃ natthi, tena vuccati asaṃvāsāti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.43.eng: She does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.0.2.eng: Both having lust: contact below the collar bone but above the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.1.pli: Ubhatoavassute adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.1.eng: If both have lust and either of them makes physical contact, below the collar bone but above the knees, body to body, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.2.eng: If either of them, with their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.2.comm: Something connected to the body means any contact that is not skin to skin, such as contact through clothes. That touching through clothes does not count as touching body to body is supported by two of the Vinayas in Chinese translation, namely, the Dharmaguptaska Vinaya and the Sarvāstivāda Vinaya.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.3.eng: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.4.eng: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.5.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.6.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.7.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with something released by the other, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.8.0.eng: Both having lust: contact above the collar bone or below the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.8.1.pli: Ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.8.1.eng: If either of them makes physical contact, above the collar bone or below the knees, body to body, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.9.eng: If either of them, with their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.10.eng: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.11.eng: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.12.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.13.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.14.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with something released by the other, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.15.0.eng: Only the nun having lust: contact below the collar bone but above the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.15.1.pli: Ekatoavassute adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.15.1.eng: If only the nun has lust and either of them makes physical contact, below the collar bone but above the knees, body to body, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.15.1.comm: The Pali just says that, “One of them has lust”, ekatoavassute, without specifying who. However, it seems reasonable that this should refer to the nun, since it is hard to imagine she would incur an offense if her mind were pure. This supposition is supported by Sp 2.662: Ekatoavassuteti ettha kiñcāpi ekatoti avisesena vuttaṁ, tathāpi bhikkhuniyā eva avassute sati ayaṁ āpattibhedo vuttoti veditabbo, “‘One of them has lust’: here, although it is said ‘one of them’ without distinction, still it is to be understood that this offense is said to be incurred only when the nun has lust.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.16.eng: If either of them, with their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.17.eng: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.18.eng: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.19.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.20.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.21.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with something released by the other, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.22.0.eng: Only the nun having lust: contact above the collar bone or below the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.22.1.pli: Ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.22.1.eng: If either of them makes physical contact, above the collar bone or below the knees, body to body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.23.eng: If either of them, with their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.24.eng: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.25.eng: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.26.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.27.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.28.eng: If either of them, with something released by them, makes physical contact with something released by the other, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.29.0.eng: Both having lust: contact with other beings below the collar bone but above the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.29.1.pli: Ubhatoavassute yakkhassa vā petassa vā paṇḍakassa vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggahassa vā adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.29.1.eng: If both have lust and she makes physical contact with a spirit, a ghost, a paṇḍaka, or an animal in human form, below the collar bone but above the knees, body to body, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.29.1.comm: In this case, it seems implied by the genitive case ending for the various kinds of beings that it is only the nun who is making the contact. That the being in question is male is implied by the fact that there is no offense for touching a female human being. For a discussion of paṇḍaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.30.eng: If she, with her own body, makes physical contact with something connected to their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.31.eng: If she, with something connected to her own body, makes physical contact with their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.32.eng: If she, with something connected to her own body, makes physical contact with something connected to their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.33.eng: If she, with something released by her, makes physical contact with their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.34.eng: If she, with something released by her, makes physical contact with something connected to their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.35.eng: If she, with something released by her, makes physical contact with something released by them, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.36.0.eng: Both having lust: contact with other beings above the collar bone or below the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.36.1.pli: Ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.36.1.eng: If she makes physical contact with them, above the collar bone or below the knees, body to body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.37.eng: If she, with her own body, makes physical contact with something connected to their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.38.eng: If she, with something connected to her own body, makes physical contact with their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.39.eng: If she, with something connected to her own body, makes physical contact with something connected to their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.40.eng: If she, with something released by her, makes physical contact with their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.41.eng: If she, with something released by her, makes physical contact with something connected to their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.42.eng: If she, with something released by her, makes physical contact with something released by them, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.43.0.eng: Only the nun having lust: contact with other beings below the collar bone but above the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.43.1.pli: Ekatoavassute adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.43.1.eng: If only the nun has lust and she makes physical contact with them, below the collar bone but above the knees, body to body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.44.eng: If she, with her own body, makes physical contact with something connected to their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.46.eng: If she, with something connected to her own body, makes physical contact with something connected to their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.47.eng: If she, with something released by her, makes physical contact with their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.50.0.eng: Only the nun having lust: contact with other beings above the collar bone or below the knees

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.50.1.pli: Ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.50.1.eng: If she makes physical contact with them, above the collar bone or below the knees, body to body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.54.eng: If she, with something released by her, makes physical contact with their body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.3.8.eng: if she is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.3.9.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.3.10.eng: The fifth offense entailing expulsion is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.3.10.comm: The Pali says the “first offense”, but since I am including the four rules entailing expulsion that the nuns have in common with the monks, I get “fifth offense” instead. That this is the correct way of counting is confirmed by the word-commentary of the present rule, which states that the pi, “too”, of ayampi refers to the preceding pārājika rules. The equivalent adjustment is required for the next three rules entailing expulsion.
